title: Drawing, "Slope of the Mount of Olives, Jerusalem, Palestine [Jerusalem, Israel]", February 7 and 10, 1868
medium:
Recto: Graphite on gray paper
Verso: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper
inscribed:
Recto:  Inscribed in graphite, at left beneath tower:  tower at lydd; again beside:  this tower does not belong to the landscape; again at top left: Lydda; again [?] beside distant town: tombs; and again at bottom right: Ramleh / Feb. 7th / 68 / from Ramleh tower.

Verso:  Inscribed in graphite, at various locations: should be higher / grey brown rubbish / stones / occasional green streaks; and at bottom the date followed by: 2 Absaloms Tomb / 3 Jews graves / Loose stones / brosy (?) / where nestles / Walls brownish gold color [?]
description:
Recto:  Horizontal view of a tower rising behind a wall with a broken arch at left, a distant view of a town with a mountain range in the background.
Verso:  Horizontal view of the slope of a hill with a Muslim shrine on top, left seen at the right of the sheet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Slope of the Mount of Olives, Jerusalem, Palestine [Jerusalem, Israel]", February 7 and 10, 1868.
February 7 and 10, 1868. Recto: Graphite on gray paper
Verso: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-184.
